wikipedia_page.main: W. Lawson Butt (4 March 1880 – 14 January 1956) was a British actor and film director of the silent era.

response: * Lawson Butt as Dathan, The Discontented

Dathan is also depicted in the 1923 silent film version of the same story, with Lawson Butt in the role. As the Moses story only takes up a portion of this film, Dathan's role is correspondingly smaller.

The story spreads across the country (mostly on account of Burke), and people flock in from all over to visit the Patriarch and be healed. When a millionaire, Richard King (W. Lawson Butt), brings his sister to be healed, he gives Burke $50,000 after the Patriarch cures her. During this visit, King meets Rose, and the two fall in love.

The Goddess of Lost Lake is a 1918 American silent era drama film starring Louise Glaum, Lawson Butt, and Hayward Mack.
*Lawson Butt as Mark Hamilton

The Lady of the Lake is a 1928 British romance film directed by James A. FitzPatrick and starring Percy Marmont, Benita Hume and Lawson Butt. It is based on the 1810 poem The Lady of the Lake by Walter Scott.

City of Play is a 1929 British drama film directed by Denison Clift and starring Chili Bouchier, Patrick Aherne and Lawson Butt.BFI.org It was made by Gainsborough Pictures and produced by Michael Balcon. It was made partly in sound.Low p.205
* Lawson Butt as Tambourini

Afterwards is a 1928 British silent drama film directed by Lawson Butt and starring Marjorie Hume, Julie Suedo and Joseph R. Tozer. It was made at Bushey Studios, and based on a novel by Kathlyn Rhodes.

Truax reappeared on November 6, 1911, for a six-week engagement at Boston's Majestic Theatre playing opposite Frank Campeau in Charles Klein's drama The Outsiders. She was next seen in San Francisco as the head of theatrical company that featured Thurlow Bergen as her leading man. Over a five or six week engagement at the city's Alcazar Theatre the two starred in productions of Mrs. Dane's Defence,Alcazar. Oakland Tribune September 15, 1912, p. 3 Lady Windermere's Fan,Alcazar. Oakland Tribune September 22, 1912, p. 4 MotherAlcazar. Oakland Tribune September 29, 1912, p. 13 and The Nigger.Alcazar. Oakland Tribune October 6, 1912, p. 9 At the Metropolitan Opera House on May 2 of the following year, Truax played the Spirit of Justice to Pauline Frederick's Spirit of Women and Lillian Nordica's Columbia, in a women's suffrage pageant production of The Dream of Freedom.Beauty Types on Display in Suffrage Show. Syracuse Herald, April 15, 1913, p. 1Won't Hurl Stones Or Use Torch, But Will Go Behind Footlights To Help Win Battle For Votes. The Daily News (Fredericksburg, Maryland), May 2, 1913, p.3 On June 30, 1913, she began a six-week engagement at Pittsburgh's Grand Opera House performing the title rôle in Charles Hale Hoyt's farce-comedy A Contented Woman.The Grand, Pittsburg. Charleroi Mail (Charleroi, Pennsylvania),  June 28, 1913, p. 8 Beginning that fall and on into the spring of 1914 she was Domini Enfilden to Lawson Butt's Boris Androvsky in road productions of The Garden of Allah, a play by Mary Anderson based on the book by Robert Smythe Hichens.Theaters. Indianapolis Star, November 25, 1913, p. 15Small Items. Hamilton Daily Republican News (Hamilton, Ohio), April 6, 1914, p. 8 Truax again played Domini in The Garden of Allah in an extended tour that began in the fall of 1916 and ended in March 1918 after closing out a near four-week run at Broadway's Manhattan Opera House.The Garden of Allah. Brazil Weekly Democrat (Brazil, Indiana), December 6, 1917, P. 1 She later starred opposite William Faversham in a 1925 continental tour with Zoë Akins' drama, Footloose.William Faversham. Reading Eagle  (Reading, Pennsylvania), September 27, 1925, p. 14
Beyond the Crossroads is a 1922 American silent melodrama film starring Ora Carew and Lawson Butt. It was directed by Lloyd Carleton.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films: Beyond the Crossroads
*Lawson Butt as John Pierce / James Fordham

Any Woman is a 1925 American silent drama film directed by Henry King and written by Randolph Bartlett, Jules Furthman, Arthur Somers Roche and Beatrice Van. The film stars Alice Terry, Donald Reed, Margarita Fischer, Lawson Butt, Aggie Herring, James Neill, and Henry Kolker. The film was released on May 4, 1925, by Paramount Pictures.Progressive Silent Film List: Any Woman at silentera.com

The Danger Trail is a 1917 American silent adventure film directed by Frederick A. Thomson and starring H.B. Warner, Violet Heming and Lawson Butt.Langman p.103 It is based on the 1910 novel of the same title by James Oliver Curwood. It is a Northern (genre), set during the construction of the Hudson Bay Railway in Canada.
